‘Interaction with other ESRS’, ESRS E2 paragraph 7 and 8 make clear its interaction with other
environmental and social topics. As an example, ESRS E2 paragraph 7 (c) indicates ‘Pollution as a
direct impact driver of biodiversity loss’ (ESRS E4) when considering other environmental impacts,
and ESRS E4 (biodiversity and ecosystem) refers to ‘Spills of polluting effluents’ as an example of
policy transition risk (E4-IRO-1 paragraph AR9 (b)(i)).
